title: MILAB Workshop in Budapest
content:
At the MILAB event hosted by ELTE, I was fortunate to present two of my posters, focusing on the innovative BlinkLinMulT system and the dynamics of group personality in task-oriented settings.
The experience of showcasing my work, receiving feedback, and engaging in stimulating conversations was incredibly rewarding.
I'm truly grateful for the opportunity to connect with other researchers who are exploring similar areas of interest.

title: WARWICK-MILAB Workshop in Budapest
content: At the WARWICK-MILAB event hosted by SZTAKI, I had the privilege of presenting a poster on my BlinkLinMulT and group personality projects. This gathering offered an invaluable platform for showcasing my research outcomes and engaging with a community of experts deeply invested in advancing AI.

title: MTA SZTAKI Students' Forum 15.0
content: The 15.0 Students' Forum welcomed attendees with presentations covering various topics. Notable talks included Dr. Viharos Zsolt János discussing the strategic context of research, Dr. Kerepesi Csaba on aging research using machine learning. I shared advancements in two areas of my research during the event: the estimation of personality traits in social interactions and the progress made in eye blink detection.

alt: Poster presentation about eye blink detection using BlinkLinMulT
title: Poster presentation at Hungarian Machine Learning Meeting
content: At the national machine learning and AI event organized by MILAB and coordinated by SZTAKI, I had the amazing opportunity to present my work on BlinkLinMulT for eye blink detection and discuss my research on group affect during goal-oriented task solving. It was a fantastic experience to exchange ideas and connect with the community. I'm truly grateful for such a wonderful opportunity.

alt: Presentation about Real-time Perceived Personality Estimation: Strong Group Formation in Goal-Oriented Collaborative Tasks at Centre for Cognitive Science seminar, Comenius University in Bratislava
title: Presentation at Centre for Cognitive Science seminar, Bratislava
content: I'm sincerely thankful for the opportunity to share my work on perceived personality estimation at the CNC seminar, Comenius University in Bratislava. Delving into the intricacies of personality traits, group dynamics, and blink detection offered a chance to highlight the potential of real-time personality assessments in improving collaborative tasks and teamwork efficiency.

alt: Personality traits, group-personality and blinking estimation during goal-oriented tasks
title: PE-MIK Seminar

alt: Presentation about Multimodal estimation and possible use of "Perceived Personality Traits" in human-robot joint task solving
title: Presentation at AI Seminar of NJSZT and ELTE
content:
As a guest presenter, I had the pleasure of contributing to the AI Seminar series organized by the John von Neumann Computer Society (NJSZT) and the Department of Artificial Intelligence at ELTE IK.
The event took a hybrid format.

alt: Personality traits, group-personality and blinking estimation during goal-oriented tasks
title: PPKE ITK Seminar

alt: Multimodal estimation of perceived personality traits and potential use in human-robot joint task solving
title: DE-IK Seminar

alt: Presentation about personality and group-personality estimation during task solving
title: Presentation at XVIII Hungarian Congress of Neuropsychopharmacology
content:
I had the opportunity to present on "Personality and Group-Personality Estimation during Task Solving" at the XVIII Hungarian Congress of Neuropsychopharmacology (MPPT), on behalf of the ELTE Department of Artificial Intelligence. The conference provided a unique platform to promote cross-disciplinary engagement.
I'm grateful for this enriching experience that allowed me to broaden the dialogue between AI research and medical practice.

title: MTA SZTAKI Students' Forum 12.0
content:
At the 12.0 Students' Forum, I had the privilege of joining a diverse group of attendees for a series of engaging presentations on a wide range of topics.
Among the highlights was Dr. Viharos Zsolt János's insightful discussion on the strategic context of research, which provided valuable perspectives for advancing our work. 
I'm thankful for the opportunity to present my latest advances in personality estimation.

title: Invited speaker at MTA SZTAKI Students' Forum 11.0
content:
At the 11.0 Students' Forum, I was honored to be among the invited speakers, presenting my work on modeling human characteristics.
It was a great opportunity to contribute to a diverse array of discussions, from feature selection algorithms like AHFS to advanced concepts in outlier detection and modeling drifting with reinforcement learning.
I'm grateful for the chance to share my insights and learn from others who are making significant strides in these fields.

title: HumanE-AI-Net workshop in Berlin
content:
Participating in the ACAI 2021 event was a game-changer for me; it was packed with enlightening microproject presentations, keynotes, and workshops all geared towards Human-Centered AI collaboration.
It not only broadened my understanding of microproject management but also connected me with fellow researchers across Europe, truly fostering a spirit of innovation in AI.
